intro: Palicourea perquadrangularis var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed palicourea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a red calyx. It is typically found in humid, lowland forest environments, growing as an understory shrub. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
